basics.name: Mario Rico Ibáñez
basics.label: Telecommunications Engineer | Machine Learning Researcher
basics.summary: Telecommunications Engineer pursuing Master's in Computer Science at EPFL, with a Bachelor's degree in Telecommunications Engineering from UPV and enrolled in a long-term Mathematics program at UNED. Specialized in Deep Reinforcement Learning for UAV networks and telecommunications optimization. Research focus on applying advanced AI techniques to solve complex problems in mobile networks, with expertise in scalable systems and distributed computing.

work.name: Computer Vision & Behaviour Analysis Lab
work.summary: Developed SOTA text models for Multilabel Emotion Recognition within a psychology context.
highlights: Developed SOTA text models for Multilabel Emotion Recognition within a psychology context
Conducted research on Deep Learning for Emotion Recognition, comparing Encoder-only Transformers (like BERT and RoBERTa) with Decoder-only Transformers (like Llama-2, Mistral, Qwen)
Explored the explainability of Large Language Models in the context of Emotion Recognition

work.name: Instituto de Telecomunicaciones y Aplicaciones Multimedia
work.summary: Developing 5G/6G multi-carrier, massive MIMO, GPU-based system-level wireless communication simulator.
highlights: Developing 5G/6G multi-carrier, massive MIMO, GPU-based system-level wireless communication simulator (PyTorch)
Utilizing Deep Reinforcement Learning strategies to optimize the placement of Base Stations

Investigating the applicability of Deep Reinforcement Learning techniques in telecommunications and endeavoring to implement algorithms across varied scenarios, including singular 4G layer, multi-layer environments, and several distributions of users
Supervised by Prof. Valery Naranjo Ornedo and Dr. David López Pérez

projects.name: Adversarial Attacks on Image-to-Image Generative Models
projects.summary: Query-free adversarial attack framework targeting state-of-the-art diffusion models including InstructPix2Pix, Kandinsky, and Stable Diffusion.
highlights: Developed query-free attacks using Auto-PGD optimization without model access
Demonstrated universal vulnerability across VAE and CLIP encoder architectures
Proved ineffectiveness of current defense mechanisms including RobustCLIP
Submitted to ICML 2025 - first comprehensive study of encoder-space attacks on diffusion models

projects.name: Evolution Strategies for Deep RL Pretraining
projects.summary: Explored Evolution Strategies as both standalone reinforcement learning method and pretraining step for gradient-based algorithms like DQN and PPO across multiple environments.
highlights: Implemented ES-pretrained agents for Flappy Bird, Breakout, and MuJoCo environments
Analyzed performance trade-offs between ES and traditional DRL methods
Published comprehensive comparative analysis with open-source implementation

projects.name: UAV Base Station Optimization using Deep RL
projects.summary: Deep Reinforcement Learning system for optimizing aerial base station positioning in emergency communication networks.
highlights: Developed DRL algorithms for 3D UAV positioning optimization
Implemented multi-layer environment simulations for realistic testing
Achieved significant improvements in network coverage and user satisfaction

projects.name: Emotion Detection through Audio and Text
projects.summary: Multi-modal emotion recognition system combining audio and text processing for comprehensive sentiment analysis.
highlights: Integrated multiple data modalities for improved accuracy
Implemented state-of-the-art NLP and audio processing techniques
Developed scalable architecture for real-time emotion detection
